Key Match Events: Jamiro Monteiro scored the first goal in the 17th minute
Ghana pulled the game into a tie in the 56th minute with a goal by Alexander Djiku
Cape Verde regained their lead in the 92nd minute with a goal by Gary Rodriguez
Miscellaneous Highlights: This is not the first time Ghana and Cape Verde have gone head-to-head in the tournament. Their previous encounter was in the quarter-finals of the 2013 tournament, which saw Ghana emerge victorious with a 2-0 win
Others: Cape Verde held an unbeaten record in opening matches, with one win and two draws
In recent AFCON campaigns, Ghana won just one of their last nine matches and suffered an early exit in the group stages of the previous edition
